title: How small is Singapore compared to New York City? - Quora

response.answer_text: Alas, it has been decades since I visited Singapore. It was exceedingly orderly, quite the opposite of the New York City of the time in that respect. Boring, for my taste as a lively young man. More suited for the phlegmatic old crock I’ve since become. Anyway, if NYC lost Manhattan and the Bronx, and acquired Nassau County instead, and if it were cut off from the United States, it would be similar in size and population to Singapore. That is, bigger in area and smaller in population, but only moderately so.
Singapore has about 5.6 million people, 2/3 the population of NYC
